This review will be pretty brief. I wanted to like this game...but I won't be playing it again.

The Good
Well...that was quick...

The Bad
- Bulky controls mixed with fast-paced combat make for a nice train wreck.

- The PvP is an imbalanced mess. This is frustrating for everyone. The seasoned players get paired up with new players and the new players have little chance to keep pace unless they instantly invest some cash into the game. This is not likely considering they just started. Even more-so after force-feeding players advertisement after advertisement. We all got it the first time; you want us to buy stuff. If a player doesn't get the message beforehand, they will after they realize that they only have a chance against an opponent once they have spent as much as that opponent, weather the price be time or money.

- The game is called CrimeCraft...where is the crafting? Oh, you mean that hand-full of item categories. Your character is locked into one category of crafting (A.K.A. the character's profession"). That would make sense if there where more than five tiers of items to make or that half of the items weren't null from the start.

- The advertisements are more obnoxious than the majority of the player base. One of the first things you learn about psychology is that force equals resistance. Players are forced to see advertisements on every load screen. The players are forced to make purchases in order to have some of the most basic of game play mechanics available to them. Force is applied to just about everything in this game in an attempt to nickel and dime the player.

- The missions are repetitive

I think is about time I update my review and tell you guys more about this game (Also my frustration and hope).  First, don't look at my play hours. It is also the only game I ever spent over $100 USD, For some of you, $100 might seems small change. I don't often spend more than $5 USD to purchase game, let alone spending $100 for a single game alone. This pretty much tell you how spectacular and fantastic this game was back then if you are willing to fork out such a huge amount of cash for it.

On the good old day, you cannot spend cash to purchase overpowered stuff to wreck havoc upon your enemy. You need skill, teamwork and flexibility in order to win. The only reason you pay is to get some awesome skin for your clothes or weapon. Even if you pay for those gear, those gear are pretty much average and can be easily earn by free user as long as they grind for it (You don't need to grind too hard for it either).

reviewText:
CC is basically a predecessor of the likes of Destiny and The Division, being an MMO FPS with both a singleplayer and multiplayer component. Unfortunately, while I had tons of fun with it, it's basically dead and can't be recommended for various reasons.

- The game relies on X-Trap which isn't compatible with Windows 10, thus blocking out lots of potential players.
- The game had been sold to a different team a few years ago which has long stopped supporting CC. Don't expect any kind of new content or hotfixes or whatnot. You'll rarely see any GMs and all the team seems to be doing is rolling out the same old events and bonus rates.
- The economy is heavily leaning towards those willing to spend money on CC. Most matches see at least one or two players with high-end gear impossible to get through normal means.
- A certain singleplayer mission is bugged so an NPC you need to escort gets stuck in the same place. Contacting the support does nothing and I only managed to get past it by repeatedly starting the mission over and over again until I finally got lucky.
- Another singleplayer mission has you play under the influence of some experimental drugs which has its effect grow stronger and stronger over the course of the mission. It tries so simulate dizziness and succeeds far too well at it. I had never been feeling sick when playing a game before (been gaming for more than 25 years now), but this mission had mee feeling sick for the rest of the day.

On the plus side:
+ The singleplayer campaign can't objectively be called good, but I enjoy these kinds of low-tech, cheesy FPS. It is fun blasting through various locations and the story actually is rather well-written with numerous factions fighting for power in a war-torn city.
+ There are tons of side-quests and in-game achievements (most of these are not Steam achievemnts, though)
+ There is also a great variety in game-modes and skill/weapon configurations
+ The action simply feels right thanks to accurate weapon feedback, satisfying melee combat and a roll manouever that allows for more flexibility.

All in all it once was a great game ahead of its time that shouldn't - or rather cannot be played properly anymore. If it ever gets fixed (probably would need to be sold to another team again) I'd happily dive back in,

Also a note on Steam achievements: Some of these require HEAVY grinding like the one that asks you to spend 100 days in instances (so this means a whopping 2400 hours playing not counting the time you spend in the hub areas) and others don't even unlock properly like the ones relating to gang activities.

reviewText:
GAMEPLAY : 6.5/10

CrimeCraft is basically a third person shooter MMO sets in an urban places.

As you start off the game,you're given to choose a server. Unfortunately there is only one and it have extremely few people playing it.

Once you choose that one server,you are given to create your own character.

The character creation is really really basic and lackluster giving you so little options to choose from.

There is a tutorial mode for you but since it a shooter game you wouldn't even need a tutorial to begin with if you familier playing a lot of shooter game.

The game is somewhat focus on PvE,at the same time it focus on PvP so it a balance between both.

However you only find a maximum number of 50 people playing PvP and only like 10 people playing PvE because the game start to die slowly.

There is a class system in this game. Ranging from soldier,rockeeter,sniper and so on as you progress unto the game further. You also can create your own custom class too.

Gunplay in this game felt stiff and clunky. You can toggle between first & third person mode during combat mode.

One of the most fun factors about this game is that enemy,including you can be blown into pieces depending on the weapon you are using. So yeah basically this game has a gore system and it execute it very well.

Aside from that you can earn reputation throughout your playthrough but it seems to serve no purpose rather than going for high ranking in leaderboards.

There is a tournament too but you most likely stumble to a lot of high level players.

GRAPHICS : 7/10

Considering the game came out in 2009,the graphics is pretty decent to say the least.

The urban/gangstar city look really great with some of the environment that look gritty which depict nicely how an urban city looked like.

Character models,weapons & clothing don't looked like plastic so it pretty ok i guess.

AUDIO : 6/10

Sound quality wise...is pretty acceptable.

Some of the guns sounds felt like it have some impact on them though i find the voice acting to be hilariously bad and good at the same times.

The lack of ambience make the game less appealing since i felt the world to be quite dull & empty.

LONG-LASTING APPEAL : 4/10

Despite PvP having a lot of mode and the PvE missions is pretty long but somewhat repetitive with not many different kind of objectives,the games get extremely boring very fast mainly because there is not many people playing this game ( i believe ever since APB Reloaded released,a lot of them migrate to that game ).

There is goals and achievements you can achieve too but if the game contain less player playing,it doesn't matter.

FINAL VERDICT : 5.9/10

Unfortunately i can't recommend you to play this game. Why ? Because this game have some pay 2 win features in it and the less amount of people playing this game lower down any enjoyment you had with this game.

Though if you like blowing people piece by piece and mostly for the gore factors,you could probably give it a try though.

Too bad APB Reloaded overshadowed this game a lot otherwise i might find this game an enjoyable experience with many people playing it. R.I.P Crimecraft 2009-2011

GRADE : E ( Passable )

reviewText:
As someone who chops and changes between games a lot and rarely finds a game that holds his attention for longer than an hour, CrimeCraft stood out and I've put 6 hours in over just 2 days!

It's very addictive and compelling with a satisfying storyline and dystopian ambience to it.

The PvE can feel a bit cheap but is good fun anyway for the most part, and the missions feel satisfying also.

The town hubs are seriously nice - great to explore and with a good variety of buildings and scenery.

I hear the PvP is pay-to-win and not very good, but I'm actually not big on PvP anyway (even though I know it's the heart of this game, or seems to be) so I can't speak for that.

Considering it's free and I have gotten a solid 6 hours out of it so far, I have no hesitation in recommending this, at least if the premise of the game is appealing to you, as it is to me :)

05 - Lack of players . I feel like i was playing single player with very very bad design levels, no story line whatsoever and limited customization.

There is tons of more frustration in this game . I barely managed to put 2-3 hours of effort to like this game. But hell no.

I strongly suggest: if you like good games, buy decent single player game and just enjoy. This is not single nor multiplayer game. It's complete waste of time.

You need to reach level 3 to be able to choose what kind of game you want to join... In case that didn't sound ridiculous enough: Believe it or not, you also need to be level 4 in order to access your friends list. You can't play with friends, until you've leveled until level 4 on your own. Also, after a buddy and I finally reached level 4 we added each other to our friends lists but couldn't find the requests anywhere. We've really tried, we looked everywhere we could think of... there's apparently no place that lets you accept your friend requests, or this game is just too smart for us. Also the bubbles telling you to buy new classes and spend all your hard earned cash on ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t you might end up never ever actually using are in front of half the rest of the menu, making it unclickable. You have to enter the last segment of the menu in order to be able to click any of the rest. That is great menu design! So you don't only have to unlock the friendslist and then figure out how to actually use it: You also have to figure out how to even click on it in the first place! Overall, the menu is so horrible, it's harder to understand than the game itself. It also told me to level up my classes without saying anything about what that is supposed to be good for... That starts out pretty cheap, but it gets very expensive very fast and I honestly haven't noticed any changes after leveling one class up a bit. To be fair, I did only level it up 2 times or so, it might get noticable at highter levels only, no clue. The gameplay actually wasn't too bad, but there's so many free to play shooters out there, most of them play pretty much exactly the same - usually better -, I really don't see why anyone would choose this out of all the options... Oh, you also can't jump. Spacebar is a dodge roll, which is actually a pretty neat feature, but really confusing if you're used to jumping. Changing weapons doesn't work with 1 and 2, but only with the mouse wheel and you throw a granade with F1, even though G, F, E, Q and all of the other buttons that would be so much more comfortable to press are unused. I really don't know what was going on in their minds when they layed out those controls..  I really don't know what was going on in their minds when they made any of this. Just.. why?
